page.title: 12Drinnick Mill Railway Line
page.content: This line was built in 1869/74 to connect the main line at{Burngullow} (St.Mewan) with the{Cornwall Mineral {Railway}at St.Dennis Junction. At the time it was known as the{Newquay and {Cornwall Junction Railway.}It had been intended to run a passenger service to Newquay but a difference in gauge was partly responsible for this not coming to fruition. There was standard gauge between Drinnick (Nanpean) and Newquay but from Drinnick to Burngullow was broad gauge. The line served the clay industry well and continues to operate between{Burngullow}and{Parkandillick} although the section beyond this to St.Dennis Junction has been dismantled. At Parkandillick are English China Clays calciners which complete the clay refining process.
